did.unittitle: Joseph Willcox collection of fossil shell illustrations

bioghist.p: Joseph Willcox (1829-1918) was a noted geologist and a long-term member of the Board of Trustees of the Wagner Free Institute of Science, serving as the chairman of the Committee on the Museum from 1885 until his death.

scopecontent.p: This volume contains illustrations of 38 fossil shells collected by Joseph Willcox. The original illustrations have been pasted into the volume. In his own description from the title page of the book, Willcox says: "This book contains original drawings of some of the fossil shells collected by me in North Carolina and Florida. They were made with pen and ink by Dr. J.L. McConnell of Washington, D.C. They have been reproduced in the plates of the Transactions of the Wagner Free Institute of Science. Joseph Willcox. Philadelphia, May 26th, 1898." The volume contains index of all drawings, listing each shell's name and where it was found. A letter from James B. [Secord] expressing admiration of Willcox's and McConnell's work is pasted to the rear endpaper of the volume.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
